result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Lloyd Ervin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $150 fine plus costs.  60 days to pay fine/costs or set up payment plan with the Clerk of Courts office.
Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Lloyd Ervin

records.addlTxt: 11:20 AM  Defendant Joshua Lloyd Ervin in court.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Joshua Lloyd Ervin.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant now present in court.   State moves to amend charge to Misdemeanor Possession of THC, gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to amended charge.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Misdemeanor Possession of THC.  State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation.  Court makes statement, imposes sentence.  Bond is no longer in effect.

10:47 AM   Defendant Joshua Lloyd Ervin not in court.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Joshua Lloyd Ervin.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews events in file, questions Atty Viel on defendants whereabouts.  Atty Viel unsure of defendants whereabout, requests rescheduling to give him some time to talk to probation agents regarding defendants whereabouts.  If warrant is issued, requests staying of the warrant to give him some time to try and locate defendant.  State has no objection.  Court reschedules matter.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 28, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Atty Viel requests a plea date in 30 days.  Bond remains in effect.

11:31 AM  Defendant Joshua Lloyd Ervin in court.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Joshua Lloyd Ervin.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Viel indicates defendant will be waiving his right to a preliminary hearing today.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Status conference on June 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:52 AM  Defendant Joshua Lloyd Ervin in court.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Joshua Lloyd Ervin.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant now appears in person.  Court cancels warrant.  Court questions Atty Viel on where matter is at.   Atty Viel indicates defendant was late today because he was at his probation agents office.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limits for prelim., requests a status in 30-45 days.  State has no objection.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:05 AM   Defendant Joshua Lloyd Ervin not in court.  Attorney Brittney Koenig in court for Joshua Lloyd Ervin.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews events in file, questions Atty Koenig on defendants whereabouts.  Atty Koenig unsure of defendants whereabouts.  State requests bench warrant.  Court orders bench warrant.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 19, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

12:58 PM Defendant Joshua Lloyd Ervin appeared by video from the Door County Jail.   Attorney Amanda Toonen appeared by video for Joshua Ervin.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.   Atty Toonen advises SPD will be appointing counsel to represent defendant. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Atty Toonen request balance of IA be set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 09:45 am.
